metadata.title: CVE-2019-5794 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect handling of cancelled requests in Navigation in Google Chromeprior to 73.0.3683.75 allowed a remote attacker to perform domain spoofingvia a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5794` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
